Estimating P(xi|y) for Continuous Attributes
▪ Strategy 2: Assume a certain form of probability distribution and 
estimate the probability distribution using the training data
▪ Example
– Suppose we assume that Xi follows a normal distribution given Y
– Then, we can obtain P(Xi = xi|Y = yj) as follows:
• μij: the sample mean of Xi for all training instances that belong to yj
• σij: the sample variance of such training instances
– Using the distribution, we can obtain P(Income = 120|No) as follows:
